unittitle.value: John E. Seley Ground Zero photographs

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Seventy-seven digital images documenting the destruction of the World Trade Center at Ground Zero in the two months following the terrorist attack of September 11, 2001. The photographer, John E. Seley, is a professor of Urban Planning and Geography at The City University of New York Graduate Center.

p.value: <emph render="bold">NOTE: Researchers may not view the images directly from the CD, but must consult the thumbnail printouts instead.</emph>
Credit line (for exhibition labels): John E. Seley.
Gift of John E. Seley, October 2011.
John E. Seley, PhD (University of Pennsylvania), is a professor of Urban Planning and Geography at The City University of New York Graduate Center. His wife is New York State Senator Liz Kreuger.

According to John E. Seley (in an Email message dated September 2, 2011), he assembled a CD of pictures taken by himself and several firefighters in the two months following the terrorist attack of September 11, 2001. Some photos were shot inside the office of Seeley's father-in-law on the 21st floor of the World Financial Center, "an office made famous in a picture of a beam sticking out of the building." Seeley wrote that he had "not seen any other pictures of that office from inside."

subject.value: World Trade Center (New York, N.Y.) -- Pictorial works

dsc.value:
Seventy-seven digital photographs [one CD + 13-page paper printout of thumbnails] of Ground Zero taken between September 12 and circa November 12, 2001 1 of 1 2001 Access Restrictions

Researchers may not view the images directly from the CD, but must consult the thumbnail printouts instead.
